publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4171 David Whitton: New Stobhill Hospital—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the new Stobhill Hospital, which will be one of the largest hospitals in Scotland, covering over 30,000 square feet and treating around 400,000 patients each year; notes that the new £100 million hospital is equipped with state-of-the-art imaging machines, advanced day surgery theatres and modern consulting rooms, and also notes that the new Stobhill Hospital is a key component of the overall modernisation of Glasgow’s acute hospitals that will see investments totalling over £750 million in the next six years. Supported by: Ross Finnie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Sarah Boyack*, Patricia Ferguson*
S3M-4171 New Stobhill Hospital (lodged on 18 May 2009) Andy Kerr*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Cathy Peattie*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Mary Mulligan*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-4171 New Stobhill Hospital (lodged on 18 May 2009) Karen Gillon*
